name: WSJ
text: With coronavirus infections increasing rapidly in a number of states, Dr. Anthony Fauci said a relaxed approach to public-health measures that reduce risk and spread of the coronavirus poses significant hurdles to state and federal efforts https://t.co/oqvvMSDoaR

name: WSJ
text: Some New York City business owners, desperate for revenue months into the coronavirus pandemic, are bending or breaking the rules limiting restaurants and retail stores to takeout or curbside pickup https://t.co/XFHfkVF1Pw

name: WSJ
text: From @WSJbooks: Brit Bennett’s novel "The Vanishing Half" follows light-skinned twin sisters on opposite sides of the racial divide—one accepting a life of hardship, the other rising into privilege by perpetuating a lie. @Sam_Sacks reviews. https://t.co/FDCvwTxbik

name: WSJ
text: The Supreme Court halted an execution to consider an inmate’s plea to have a chaplain accompany him in the death chamber https://t.co/XPMrojFYko

name: WSJ
text: Morgan Stanley’s former head of diversity sued the bank, saying it hadn’t done enough to promote people of color and that it fired her in December. The Wall Street firm rejected the allegations. https://t.co/4pVnDWK1Dq

name: WSJ
text: New York City is starting to end its lockdown, but as many as 25,000 of the city’s hotel rooms—or 20%—might not reopen https://t.co/KrFTqhiUvw

name: WSJ
text: From @WSJopinion: The human capacity for sacrifice, even in the face of grave danger, has limits. This is an inconvenient truth that the climate movement cannot afford to ignore, writes @wrmead. https://t.co/5Y7OjjMLs3

name: WSJ
text: Facebook is aiming to register 4 million voters before the presidential election, as well as offer voting information and political ad controls as it grapples with ongoing controversy over what to allow on its platforms https://t.co/JgHHmnSXh5

name: WSJ
text: For the past decade, San Francisco has outshined Silicon Valley in attracting tech firms and entrepreneurs. Now, that trend shows signs of reversing. https://t.co/7jVVDG42Qu

name: WSJ
text: From @WSJopinion: Broken-window policing is dead, and the largely black and Latino residents of America’s most vulnerable neighborhoods will pay the price, writes @wjmcgurn https://t.co/NgUYEjyCaW

text: Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/5gMDuGAk4F https://t.co/1eifnD4ZS4

text: Hungary’s Parliament voted to end a state of emergency that gave Prime Minister Viktor Orban the right to rule by decree, after leaders in the U.S. Congress and the E.U. accused him of using the coronavirus pandemic to amass authoritarian-like powers https://t.co/c5Dqb7pOHi

name: WSJ
text: Coronavirus lockdowns are easing on both sides of the Hudson River, but many people from New Jersey still fear mixing with those who are venturing into NYC https://t.co/Y1UbLGpxmX

name: WSJ
text: JetBlue made headlines in 2007 when passengers were stranded for hours on the tarmac at JFK during an ice storm. Former Chairman Joel Peterson explains how the company rebuilt from the Valentine’s Day crisis. https://t.co/ihYAiZeySo

name: WSJ
text: From @WSJopinion: When I returned home from prison, my greatest help and support came from the least likely people, including the federal agent who arrested me, writes @JonDPonder https://t.co/seL8aijaSC
